meanings.definition: To give assistance or aid to
meanings.sent1: The kind neighbor was succoring the elderly lady by helping her carry groceries.
meanings.sent2: The firefighters were succoring the family trapped in the burning building.
meanings.sent3: The superhero succoring the citizens was actually a cat in disguise.
meanings.sent4: Her words of encouragement were succoring his wounded spirit.
meanings.sent5: The warm soup on a cold day was succoring to the homeless man.

meanings.definition: The act of helping or supporting someone in need
meanings.sent1: The succoring of the injured hiker by the rescue team was swift and efficient.
meanings.sent2: In times of crisis, succoring from friends and family can make a big difference.
meanings.sent3: The succoring of the lost puppy by the kind girl melted everyone's hearts.
meanings.sent4: Her presence was a succoring beacon of hope in the dark times.
meanings.sent5: The succoring provided by the charity organization was a lifeline for many families.
